definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: but at least it got the juices flowing.
He has struck off a good description of the scene.
sentences.chinese: 他已把该场景清晰流畅地描述出来了。

sentences.english: Isadora liked to move her arms and legs in very smooth motions.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎多拉喜欢用非常流畅的动作摆动手臂和腿脚。

sentences.english: The thicker you paint, the more color flows.
sentences.chinese: 你涂得越厚，颜色看起来越是流畅。

sentences.english: He hadn't learned to bow smoothly yet.
sentences.chinese: 他还没学会流畅地拉琴。

sentences.english: The Arsenal manager wants to attack Villareal, playing to Arsenal's strengths of free-flowing attacking football.
sentences.chinese: 温格想以阿森纳流畅的进攻来攻击比利亚雷尔。

sentences.english: You learn to communicate your ideas.
sentences.chinese: 您可以学到如何流畅的沟通思想。

sentences.english: Emotional and transparent image of mountain streams uncontaminated streams, lively and smooth.
sentences.chinese: 情绪透明的的像山涧中未经污染的小溪，欢快而流畅。

sentences.english: Those move easiest who have learn'd to dance.
sentences.chinese: 那些动作最流畅的人必是学过舞蹈的。

sentences.english: Less data usage will improve network traffic.
sentences.chinese: 减少用户的数据使用将会提高通信网的流畅度。

sentences.english: There's nothing like seeing the whole action flowing back and forth.
sentences.chinese: 这远比不上亲眼看到整个来回的流畅动作。

sentences.english: The dynamic smooth line design illustrates the intellectual crystallization tinged with liveliness.
sentences.chinese: 动感流畅的线条设计，睿智中略带活泼情怀。

sentences.english: Wind Cavity melodious tunes pleasant, mild smooth, emotional performance than diversified.
sentences.chinese: 吹腔曲调悠扬动听，流畅温和，表现的情感亦较多样。

sentences.english: We all admire her for her free-flowing movement.
sentences.chinese: 我们对她流畅的动作赞叹不已。

sentences.english: High-strength precision rolling Ballpoint pen Tsui, fluent writing.
sentences.chinese: 高强度精密滚动走珠笔咀，能流畅的书写。

sentences.english: And there would have been no break in the flow.
sentences.chinese: 比赛的流畅性也不会有影响。

definition: to link up (disparate elements)/coherent (narrative, argument etc)
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
exquisite/fine and delicate (usu. of works of art)
sense of movement (often in a static work of art)/dynamic/vivid/lifelike
mellow and full/suave/smooth and round/rich (in voice)
